snippet: At stadiums around the league, the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks and their victims were recalled with flag displays, military tributes and predominantly traditional attention to the national anthem....
lead_paragraph: At stadiums around the league, the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks and their victims were recalled with flag displays, military tributes and predominantly traditional attention to the national anthem.
abstract: Ken Belson On Pro Football column observes that 15th anniversary of Sept 11 terrorist attacks fell on first full Sunday of football, which led to awkward meeting of football and various forms of patriotism; notes coincidence comes on heels of players like San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick protesting racial injustice by refusing to stand for national anthem before games.

headline.main: An Awkward Alignment of the Flag and Football
headline.print_headline: Awkward Alignment of the Flag and Football
